reviewText: Currently In the title of this Amazon page they spelled our epic hero's name wrong, it's Lelouch of the Rebellion![UPDATE: It's fixed now.]Anyways, Bandai Entertainment has finally stop hitting the snooze button on that alarm clock of theirs and that have finally brought us one of, if not the greatest Anime of this decade, into a complete First Season collection.(The First 25 Episodes. Does Not Include R2)This Anime truly deserves the royal treatment when it comes to releases, so I'm hoping they edit those letters that say "DVD" and change them to "Blu-ray". Anyways, If you still have not yet witnessed the intense action, excellent character and superb story of this Anime then wait no longer and see what everyone has been talking about.Code Geass Season Set: includes the following 25 Episodes on 6 Discs.1 "The Day a New Demon was Born"2 "The White Knight Awakens"3 "The False Classmate"4 "His Name is Zero"5 "The Princess and the Witch"6 "The Stolen Mask"7 "Attack Cornelia"8 "The Black Knights"9 "Refrain"10 "Guren Dances"11 "Battle for Narita"12 "The Messenger from Kyoto"13 "Shirley at Gunpoint"14 "Geass vs. Geass"15 "Cheering Mao"16 "Nunnally Held Hostage"17 "Knight"18 "I Order you, Suzaku Kururugi"19 "Island of the Gods"20  "Battle for Kyushu"21 "The School Festival Declaration"22 "Blood Stained Euphy"23 "At Least with Sorrow"24 "The Collapsing Stage"25 "Zero"*Special Features* On Season Set Include:* Disc 1 - Picture Drama Episode 1, Audio Commentary Stage 1, Audio Commentary Stage 4, Audio Commentary Stage 5, Textless Opening (version 1), Stage 2 Preview, Trailers and DVD Credits.* Disc 2 - Picture Drama Stage 3.25, Picture Drama Stage 6.75, Audio Commentary Stage 8, Textless Ending (Version 1), Trailers and DVD Credits.* Disc 3 - Picture Drama Stage 9.75, Picture Drama Stage 4.33, Audio Commentary Stage 11, Textless Opening (2ND Version of Colors), Trailers and DVD Credits.* Disc 4 - Picture Drama Stage 8.75, Audio Commentary Stage 14, Textless Ending (Mosaic Kakera), Textless Opening (1st Version of Kaidoku Funou), Trailers and DVD Credits.*Disc 5 - Picture Drama Stage 9.33, Audio Commentary Stage 19, Audio Commentary Stage 21, Textless Opening (Kaidoku Funou Version 2), Voice Actors Interviews: Johnny Yong Bosch, Yuri Lowenthal, Kate Higgins, Karen Strassman, Promotion Video Version 1, Trailers and DVD Credits.*Disc 6 - Picture Drama Stage 22.25, Picture Drama Stage 23.95, Audio Commentary Stage 25, Textless Ending (On-Air Version 23 "Mosaic Kakera"), Textless Opening (Stage 24+25 "Hitomi No Tsubasa"), Textless Ending (On-Air Version Stage 24+25 "Colors"), Promotion Video Version 2, Trailers and DVD Credits.The First Season Set is Released in a 6 Disc Slim Set and Presented in 1.78 Anamorphic Wide Screen Format. Also Contains Both the Japanese 2.0 Audio and the English 2.0 Audio (Eng Dub) Language with Optional English Subtitles. (Region 1)

reviewText: Studio Sunrise does it again! Code Geass is easily one of the best series to be released in the last decade.Of note:Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion (this series) is season one.  Basically.Code Geass: R2 is the second season and the conclusion.This set only contains the first 25 episodes.  And it ends on an insane cliff hanger.  Be warned.  Though note that R2 starts rather... oddly, but it is in fact the second season, you just have to watch through a couple of episodes to 'get it'.So this series stars Lelouch and Suzaku, young friends who become enemies on the battlefield.  The world is slowly being conquered by a despotic regime, and Lelouch becomes involved in the rebellion against this regime.  Suzaku, who also wants change, decides to try for change from the inside.  Lelouch acquires an ability called Geass, which is a rather intense power of suggestion.  When using this power he can command people to perform whatever task he sees fit, whether it be to bring him an object or even kill themselves or someone else.  The power does have limits, but it is interesting to see his use of this power and it's growth and limits throughout the series.The amazing supporting cast is what makes the show so great.  The characters are all generally likable, or unlikable as villains.  Some of the more sinister villains are the typical "I'm crushing your homeland and your spirits because I think it's better for the world in the end" kind of villains.  They see the world as being a productive and easily controlled state with a sharp division between the upper and lower castes.  Sounding oddly familiar?  A couple of supporting characters get annoying... Karen and Euphy certainly can at times.  Though CC is quite possibly one of the most interesting supporting characters in any series I have seen.The animation quality is superb. Throughout the series the quality stays consistently high, unlike many other series that source out animation to Korea or China after the first few episodes.  The voice acting (in Japanese) is superb.  I have not viewed with the English dubbing since most Sunrise animations feature amazing Japanese talent (and this series is no exception).The series does feature 'mecha' battling, though it is often a minor role in the grand scheme of things.  I actually think they could have pulled the series off without the use of 'mecha' and stuck with conventional weapons, but the mecha angle works.  And the Japanese audience really loves mecha action (as do I).  But the inclusion of mecha battling might turn off some less experienced American anime viewers.The story starts off quickly, then slows down a bit.  The initial few episodes do have that typical Gundam style.  Young buy thrust into mecha and must battle.  All that.  Though with the addition of his powers, the series does start to veer into new territory and become more interesting.  There are also some episodes that are a little more lighthearted, but overall the story is serious and progresses well.Studio Sunrise keeps to their high standards for mecha based anime (they are the studio that produces the Gundam series also).  As I mentioned above, it is my humble opinion that this is one of the better series to be released in the last decade.

reviewText: series sequencelelouch of the rebellionR2QUICK NOTE:(there is another title that will be linked to this series coming up but its not in anyway part of lelouch series , will be show on a nitemare (mech) squadron)if the below summary spoils this series for you i apologize its just a quick sum of the seasonsbasics of the series:first season:most of the world is dominated by Britannialelouch fights their rule, getting allies and funding by use of his "POWER" given by cc a mysterious girleventually his rebellion is beaten and he goes off radar till season 22nd season:lelouch has false memory's , relizes they are false and Britannia is watching his every move, slowly with the aid of his "power" he regains his allies and funding, gets more mechs and airships and launches a rebellion so that he may rule the world "MWAHAHAH", he then is run against a wall as he must fight his sister, fights takes over the world, then a sad, but predictable ending happens.NOTES FROM BUYER:it took me a year to get the last part of r2 before they released this complete season due to fact i hate the ending and dreaded it but i finally caved in.the main character is fixated on his sister, so he must make a kinder world for her, this kinda backfires for him. though i agree with his ideas some of the things he does rubs me wrong when there was other options. his best friend is kinda old fashioned and dosnt get the reality of the world till the end of r2 and joins lelouch in his plani personally think the writers went in the wrong direction in r2 in some ways, but hay i mainly watched the show for the mechs and to see if the hero could pull off world dominationbut dont get me wrong i loved the series and recommend it for those who like mechs, comedy and strategyanimation is well done and the plot is good.so enjoy if you get into the series , if not your missing out
summary: great anime but dont get warped kk?

reviewText: Code Geass is a story about a young man named Lelouch. Lelouch is a genius, and the son of the King. Japan is ruled by a foreign and tyrannical emperor. There is a poorly organized resistance group that is trying to take back their homeland. Lelouch decides to become their leader and to take revenge on his father for his sisters poor condition. He gains the power of Geass. His power allows him to make anyone he wants do exactly as he says; but he can only use it on each person once. The story tells of his rise to power and all of the tragedy that befalls him and those close to him.This anime has everything. Great story, animation, voicing, music, and lots of great characters. There is a lot of fan service and comic relief. There is also tons of action and drama. Code Geass is excellent.

reviewText: Whatever it is that you think at first when watching this anime, it's not gonna become true! This is a masterpiece. It's somewhat similar to the detective stories of Death Note or Conan but in a way different, because the main char actually has a special power that grant him his wish of changing the world. It's one of the fulliest developed anime i've seen. The ending is beautiful and shocking. You'll be swamped in surprises and suspicions. Buy it to support the author! It's the best ever

reviewText: At first I wasn't so sure about this series but after just watching the first season I am amazed at how entertained I was and am now left with just having to collect the second season sets.  The series short basic story-line info is you have the Britannia Empire seizing control and ruling over most of the world including a recently conquered Japan,  now the people of Japan are regulated as second class citizens with few rights and are pretty much expected to obey their new rulers unwaveringly but there is a small group of Japanese citizens who resist this dictatorship and so the empires military while having to deal with remnants of the Japanese military as well as resistance fighters and now we also have a young Britannia exiled noble lord who is one of the heirs to the throne by blood though considered dead by the emperor who for a horrific event in his past now seeks to destroy the empire of Britannia.  Though by accident and a varying degree of fate and chance the young noble stumble upon a mysterious person who gives him a unique ability to be able to control other people for a time,  of course there are limitations and weaknesses for this new ability but regardless the young noble seeks out to create a powerful force to challenge the power of the Britannia empire and seek his vengeance.  The series is incredible with touches that reach to most areas you have action, drama, royal court intrigue, hardcore battles, a smattering of humor and of course some romance put into it as well,  the characters are very entertaining and endearing to watch as most grow on you and you can't help but cheer for some and have a tear or two for others with what befalls some of the series characters throughout the show.  The animation is very well done but feels a little reminiscent of a couple of series like XXXholic or Tsubbasa,  the soundtrack was also very well done as well as the Japanese voice cast and though most of the English voice cast were done very well there were maybe two they should have recast for their roles especially for the dubbed role of Nunnally Lamperouge the female actress was a definite miss for this one you couldn't help but squint your eyes and wince while listening to her read her lines I mean couldn't she have made her voice less annoying and if that's how she really talks than god help her.  So for anime collectors and fans here's a great series for us to enjoy...
summary: Incredible Sci-Fi Series Mixed With Noble Intrigue

reviewerName: Saito Hajime "My reviews are short and sweet....
reviewText: Code Geass tries hard to please everyone and really it does. Its like watching every good anime you have ever seen rolled into one.Unfortunately it can feel pretty derivative and filled with anime cliches but thats okay. The production values are all top notch so its awesome to look at and the music is great.The story is about a boy named Lelouch who's desire is to take down the Britannian Empire. He acquires the power to control peoples minds and he uses this power to become a rebellion leader and alter ego, Zero. Its a good story with a lot of twists and drama and I enjoyed every minute of it. Except for the classroom scenes were a bit lame and fan servicey.I would compare this show to Gundam, Death Note and S-Cry-Ed. Its definitely a must-see and buy anime because it is just plain entertaining.This release is all of the discs formerly released in one set and includes all the extras, which are actually pretty good.Just a warning, there is a sequel series out now called Code Geass R2. This set leaves you on a cliff hanger, so be ready to buy both.
summary: Awesome show. Something for everyone. Great full release.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This show is an absolute masterpiece. By the end of this first season I was blown away! This show has everything, action, drama, sabotage, romance, strategy, just about everything. This show does have a "gundam" element to it as well. This anime is in my top 3! This season has a total of 25 episodes, containing 6 disks. The box set also includes extra picture dramas that give more plot to the story. It also has clean openings/endings, commentaries and the ability to switch to the original japanese voice actors. I highly praise this anime for it's soundtrack as well. It is a perfect fit to every scene in this show. The anime is cleanly drawn and unique. I highly recommend this show to any anime fan.
summary: One of the best animes out there!

reviewText: As I am not an avid fan of mecha anime, this first season of the franchise was quite enjoyable. The main character becomes the villain slowly but surely, unlike a certain other anime in which the main character becomes bad right away. The part about Japanese people reduced to being called a number was pretty harsh and the discrimination that comes with it a little unnecessary. I wished the mecha parts were a bit toned down, as in not having them as much as they did. I do recommend this series if you like mecha or like having the main character become evil in a nice pace but I personally don't recommend it because it just doesn't suit my interests.
